too no changes in detergent we use detergent with no dyes and perfumes and have been using it since he was born the weird thing is the hives go away after bath and cold compress and its been happening for three days already it was the worst today out of all three days heat rash maybe if it has been going on for days and today is the worst day would probably go see doctor to ease your mind and not much as like reddit most who will comment are not qualified to give you good medical advice good luck poor baby yeah we are taking him to see doctor today agree will be taking him in today was curious if there were any mamas out there that experienced something similar in the meantime he is breathing fine and super happy so the on call doc said its not considered an emergency but to call the clinic when they open in an hour thank you could it be viral rash terrifying to watch it spread but totally harmless would take lo into the ped to check it out long shot here but if they seem to get better after awhile is he by chance sleeping in weird way where he ends up pressing up against the crib bars the pattern in the picture you shared could potentially look like spacing of crib bars not sure what the rest of them look like so could be totally off just thought gt he is breathing fine and super happy so the on call doc said its not considered an emergency but to call the clinic when they open in an hour my boys both had some occurrence of hives especially the oldest it usually started on his trunk and worked outward depending on how severe his breakout was if it was on his face it was usually bad episode but even those were relatively mild no fever no respiratory involvement and no real discomfort it just looked bad and maybe itched treatment was oral steroid prednisone which slapped down the reaction super quick in our case we believe the hives were an autoimmune response after viral infection but doctors were able to pin it down to specific trigger it be like that sometimes both boys outgrew the reaction by or so as recall hope your little guy has similarly easy scenario my daughter kept getting weird hives my pediatrician said basically barring an allergic reaction kids sometimes get rashes and we most of the time never figure out why they have really sensitive skin and their immune systems are flexing and testing things out and they just get hives sometimes don take this to mean you should take your little one to the doc but also don be dismayed if they never figure it out something else to consider that have seen mentioned is possible food allergy we just had one of our month old twins do skin test based on tracking my food intake and he skin tested positive for wheat and bananas currently eliminating those from my diet and then we ll test it again in few weeks so just because he ebf does mean that there might not be food allergy coming through your milk just something to mention to your doc good luck if it going away when he cools down it probably heat rash hope the doctor is able to ease your mind and help your little guy feel better my daughter used to get hives when she had virus take her to the dr to get his take but with her it was always the first sign she had virus coming on we had no problems no changed in eating habits detergent etc until months lo had his first round of shots and the next day he was covered head to toe in rash it lasted for months and only got better after baths dr could figure out what the problem was about 15 months later gave him snack of almond butter on cracker he went into immediate anaphylaxis and we rushed him to urgent care turned out after an allergy panel he is severely allergic to dogs cats cashews pistachios and other tree nuts had been eating cashews to up my fat intake while was nursing had changed anything in my diet but think the shots lowered his immune system and he became systematic the allergist also said the more they are exposed to something their body sees as an enemy the worse their reactions will get over time that why the first time he had the almond butter with cashew in it also he had such severe reaction sorry this is so long but just wanted to say sometimes it does matter if there is no change good luck at the dr have mastocytosis on the brain since they ruled it out for me personally it more common in children go to an allergist the rash is suspicious have you heard of roseola it one of those common childhood illnesses same with my little boy no fever no respiratory movement goes away after cool touches the area have feeling docs wont able to pin it down either good to know your boys outgrew the reaction thank you at least he not distressed when my 3mo little girl scratched her eye we freaked out but she only cried for like 45 min impressed she was so chill it honestly the only reason was mess the whole hours not sure if it will help but my daughter 9yr just had slapped cheek syndrome which presents with body rash and red cheeks the rash occurs week or more after the contagious period my little guy had his months vaccines on wednesday of last week and broke out in this insane scary rash on saturday we actually ended up taking him to the er sunday night because it was spreading so fast they didn have any answers but we went into the ped office monday morning and found out he has roseola which might ve been triggered should clear up in about week he feeling much better this morning mine as well it was always completely harmless and went away as quickly as it came but always consult with doctor nevertheless that
